title: Eurostat: 2024 EU greenhouse gas emissions: -20% since 2013
content: In 2024, the EU economy’s greenhouse gas emissions by economic activities and households totalled 3.3 billion tonnes of CO2 equivalents.

title: European Tourism Day advances work on the EU’s upcoming tourism strategy
content: Commissioner for Sustainable Transport and Tourism, Apostolos Tzitzikostas, will host the European Tourism Day in Brussels on 26 January.

title: EU needs to invest €70 billion per year in climate adaptation up to 2050
content: The EU, its Member States and the private sector should invest about €70 billion per year until 2050 in climate adaptation, to reduce exposure to increasing climate hazards and improve resilience...

title: Commissioner Jørgensen at the North Sea Summit to advance the expansion of EU offshore wind energy, boost energy independence
content: On Monday, Commissioner for Energy and Housing Dan Jørgensen will participate in the North Sea Summit in Hamburg (Germany), an international event hosted by the German Federal Government to boost cross-border cooperation on expanding offshore wind energy.

title: EU deploys emergency generators as Russian strikes leave 1 million Ukrainians without power in -20°C
content: The European Commission is today deploying 447 emergency generators from EU strategic reserves to restore power to hospitals, shelters and critical services. The generators - mobilised from rescEU strategic reserves hosted in Poland - will be distributed to the most affected communities.

title: EU–Norway Green Alliance: partners review progress and next steps
content: The EU and Norway met for the annual implementation meeting of the EU–Norway Green Alliance, reviewing progress and exploring next steps to deepen cooperation on climate action, clean energy, industrial decarbonisation, resilience and international climate and environmental diplomacy.

title: Commission delivers further CAP simplification up to €215 million for farmers and national administrations
content: The Commission adopted nine CAP acts cutting red tape, easing burdens and saving farmers time and up to €215 million annually.

title: EUDIS Hackathon Autumn 2025 Edition EU-Wide Pitching Competition WinnersEUDIS Hackathon Autumn 2025 Edition EU-Wide Pitching Competition Winners
content: The EUDIS Hackathon Autumn 2025 edition brought together Europe’s most promising innovators to address critical challenges in space and defence.

title: Research and legislation changes promote migrant integration and access to the labour market in Finland
content: Finland introduced a new unemployment rule for third-country national holders of work-based residence permits, as well as a comprehensive reform which restricts access to non-urgent medical services. Meanwhile, new reports show the country's migration and labour market ecosystem.

title: Supporting newcomers in France: employment, civic exams and residence policy
content: French local authorities are requesting greater labour participation among legally residing foreigners and a new law proposal aims to make the renewal of multi-year residence permits automatic in France, as a barometer survey finds that discrimination remains the most common barrier to employment.

title: Implementation dialogue on industry priorities on the path to EU defence readiness with High Representative and Vice-President Kaja Kallas
content: HR/VP Kaja Kallas will hold an implementation dialogue on 28 January 2026.

title: New initiatives promote migrant integration and social cohesion in Luxembourg
content: 11 projects have been selected to receive AMIF funding in Luxembourg and have since begun their activities. At the same time, three new national action plans to promote an inclusive society have been adopted and a new toolbox to help municipalities tackle racism was developed.

title: Changes to procedures for migrants in Poland
content: In Poland, procedures for legalisation of stay will be fully digitalised in 2026. A significant increase in fees for documents authorising the employment of foreigners has entered into effect, and measures to support Ukrainians displaced by the war in Ukraine will be phased out as of March 2026.

title: Intergenerational fairness in the EU: income and housing dynamics in the context of demographic change
content: The report explores the income and housing situation of different generations in the EU, assessing the implications for intergenerational fairness and their connection to demographic change.

title: Housing investment needs in the EU
content: Housing demand varies considerably between Member States and regions, reflecting diverse demographic and market conditions. In one third of all NUTS 3 regions, construction did not manage to keep up with expanding demographic trends.

title: Integration policy and programme developments and immigration statistics in Denmark
content: Denmark will be extending Temporary Protection for Ukrainians following the EU's decision. Meanwhile, a new scheme facilitates labour migration from 16 countries, a new system for social benefits affects migrants, and a new official website for newcomers was launched.

title: Public consultation on new EU rules to fight organised crime
content: The European Commission has launched a public consultation to help prepare new EU rules to counter organised crime. The consultation is open for feedback until 10 April 2026 (midnight Brussels time).

title: Recommendation Note on access to alternative residency pathways and solutions for refugees from Ukraine with temporary protection in Hungary
content: The UNHCR published new guidelines outlining the legal pathways available to refugees from Ukraine in Hungary and the practical factors affecting their transition from Temporary Protection to longer-term residence. The guidance draws on discussions held at the Refugee Coordination Forum in May 2025.

title: EU Mission on Adaptation launches new portal to support a climate-resilient Europe
content: The EU Mission on Adaptation to Climate Change has launched a new portal bringing together data, tools and real-world solutions to help regions, cities and communities assess climate risks and accelerate adaptation across Europe.

title: Strengthening residency administration and advancing migrant integration in Slovakia
content: Slovakia is expanding the capacity of its Foreign Police to improve residency administration and better support migrant integration, while a series of recently published studies focus on integration policies, access to social services and barriers encountered by African migrants.

title: GLACY-e: Peru launches first national training on gender and cybercrime
content: Peru launches its first national specialised training programme focused on the gender dimension of online crime.

title: Shaping Heidelberg’s climate-neutral future: Meet Eckart Würzner, Mayor and Covenant Board Member
content:
The Mayor of Heidelberg, Germany, and member of the EU Covenant of Mayors Board, Eckart Würzner, shares
his perspective on sustainable urban leadership and the role of cities in delivering EU climate objectives.

title: Commission opens in-depth investigation into arbitration award ordering Bulgaria to pay compensation to ACF
content: The European Commission has opened an in-depth investigation to assess whether an arbitration award, in which Bulgaria is ordered to pay compensation to ACF Renewable Energy Limited for changes to a renewable electricity support measure, is in line with EU State aid rules.

title: Rooftop solar could meet 40% of EU’s long-term electricity demand
content: A new EU-wide analysis shows that rooftop solar photovoltaics could supply around 40% of Europe’s electricity by 2050.

title: Announcement of next auction (EU-Bonds) on 26-01-2026
content: Auction announcement EU-Bonds.

title: Joint press release by Minister Akazawa Ryosei (Japan) and Executive vice-president Stéphane Séjourné (European Commission)
content: During the WEF in Davos, Minister Akazawa Ryosei (Japan) and Executive vice-president Stéphane Séjourné (European Commission) reaffirmed their intention to advance cooperation in wide-ranging areas under the Japan-EU Competitiveness Alliance launched at the 30th Japan-EU Summit  on July 23, 2025.

title: New anti-racism strategy pushes for equality for all, also in housing
content: The strategy sets out to tackle barriers and foster inclusion. The Commission intends to carry out a study to assess risks and identify solutions for improving housing for the most vulnerable groups. Read the full press release here.

title: Supporting digital connectivity with simpler rules
content: Learn about EU plans to boost digital connectivity with simpler, harmonised rules, encouraging investment in advanced connectivity, and improving network security

title: Farewell to ESDE quarterly, welcome quarterly EESO: Quarterly European Employment and Social Outlook published
content: This week signs the launch of our new publication, the Quarterly European Employment and Social Outlook.

title: Commission announces members of third Platform on Sustainable Finance
content: The European Commission has published the list of members for the third mandate of the Platform on Sustainable Finance.
